algorithm_technique: Breadth-First Search (BFS) to find friends at a specific level, then count video frequencies.
problem_summary_simple: Find videos watched by friends of friends at a specific level, ordered by frequency.
problem_summary_technical: Perform BFS from `id` to find people at `level`, collect their watched videos, count frequencies, and sort.
time_complexity: O(N + V + E + F log F), where N is people, V is videos, E is friendships, F is unique videos at level
key_insights: This problem can be solved using a Breadth-First Search (BFS) approach to explore friends layer by layer.
A set is useful for keeping track of visited individuals to avoid cycles and redundant processing.
A Counter is efficient for aggregating video frequencies, and sorting by frequency then alphabetically handles the output requirement.
